intro: Lonchitis lindeniana var. decomposita, commonly known as the decomposed lichen, is a rare and specialized lichen species. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is characterized by its unique thallus structure, which is typically crustose and pale in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungal partner and a green alga, which allows it to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. It is often found on rock surfaces in temperate and boreal regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered an indicator species for environmental stability and is of interest to ecological researchers.
